intro: Koellensteinia alba, commonly known as the white koellensteinia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, white flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance. Koellensteinia alba is also of interest to botanists due to its ecological adaptations to harsh mountain climates.
